subject: VAM motors failing
description_text:
Hi, just installed my 3 VAM haptics on the Plus X pedals. One motor has
completely died and another is stuck at a very low permanent rumble. This
is after about 2 sim hours total. Please help!

Matt Verille
954-604-4802

conversations.body_text: Hi Matt Verille,    Please make sure you are using SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.0. The vibration strength must be adjusted strictly according to the software settings. In most cases, motor damage occurs because the strength level was set too high. Also, the parameters in SimHub 9.9.3 should be referenced and kept consistent.  Important notes:    Do not use continuous vibration telemetry such as speed or rpm, as these signals may damage the VAM motor.    VAM Pro is not affected, since its motor design allows continuous operation.    By design, the VAM motor cannot operate at continuous high intensity.    Please cross-test the VAM motors. If they are confirmed damaged, we will send you 2 replacement motors. However, it is essential that you always follow the maximum strength limits set in the software to prevent further damage.

Thanks for the reply. I've kept the strength consistent at 50% across all
haptics, tried different ports on the haptic reactor, and the same problems
persist. I've used both Simsonn Manager 2.1.0 and Simhub and the results
are consistent across both. Definitely two defective motors. What do you
need from me to replace both motors? The haptics were purchased July 21,
2025 on Amazon but I had to wait to install them on the Plus X pedals
purchased on August 9, 2025 also on Amazon.
